name: Wolcott Hotel

reviews.text: I have been to NYC before and was fully aware that the hotels can be pretty basic but none the less ok for the short time you spend in the room. However, this hotel was AWFUL! I would not recommend anyone to stay here. As we arrived the man on reception didn’t even look up which was a bad start. When we got up to our room I was horrified, the smell was disgusting. I knew that the hotel was very old but that was a smell I will never forget. The first thing I did was to buy some glade to get rid of the terrible smell. We didn’t let this ruin our stay, we just made sure we spent as little time as possible in the hotel. As people have said it’s a great location, when you stand outside the hotel and look up you can see the Empire State building which was fantastic. It was an excellent price but next time I will pay a little bit extra to stay in a decent hotel and will definitely give the Wolcott a miss. The worst part of the trip was the last day when we had to use the “shower room” as we had an evening flight and had to check out at 12noon. We were given a key to a dirty shower, a stained toilet and a sink. We decided not to use the shower as it was so dirty and instead had to make do with having a quick wash. This was not ideal especially as we had a 7 hour flight and couldn’t have a shower as the facilities provided were not clean. This hasn’t put me off New York it’s a great City and my time there was fantastic. I did read the reviews on here before I went and noticed they were mixed but I would suggest you do not stay here.
reviews.title: Definitely give this hotel a miss! AWFUL!

reviews.text: An excellent find! Stayed here on a performing arts trip to New York with my school, didn't expect such a good place for the money we had paid for the trip! It's spotless and comfortable, in a perfect location, only about one block from The Empire State Building and a 10 minute walk from Times Square! The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but every morning you can go to the lobby and get muffins and tea or coffee included so breakfast was sorted! A perfect hotel for our visit!
reviews.title: Surprisingly, a lovely hotel, in a really good location!

reviews.text: This is a VERY nice place....I've don't think I have ever stayed at a better budget-hotel.
reviews.title: Just do it!

reviews.text: But remember...it is a BUDGET-hotel...so don't go expecting a big plasma-tv, a fancy resturante and a wonderfull veiw....and who cares....it's new york...your not there to stay in your room.
reviews.title: Perfect for out first time visit to NYC

reviews.text: The rooms are clean and big, the morning muffins are wonderfull, the staff is so very nice, the rooms got airconditioning and you could not ask for a better location....right outside the hotel lobby you look directly up at Empire State Building. You are between 5th and broadway on 31st....and on the same street as a lovely little wine and chocolate bar (Ayza), that serves wonderfull french and italian food at fine prices....reel new york feeling at this place....we were there so many times....really good when you get enough of burger and fries ;)
reviews.title: Wolcott Hotel is a place I will continually return to!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Wolcott is located in the heart of Manhattan, NYC. If you are planning to enjoy NYC then this is the perfect place to stay. You can see ESB which is 3 blocks from the hotel. TimesSquare is 10mins walk. There were many restaurants near the hotel. Minar indian restaurant is just opp to the hotel. Coffee and Muffins are free when you are staying in this Hotel. Subways are very near to the hotel and are easily accessible. We covered almost all attractions of NYC when we stayed in this hotel. Rooms are very clean and compact. Staffs are very polite and helpful. Lobby is very rich look and the sofas are very royal. The interior design of th hotel is very awesome. I love staying at Hotel Wolcott.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay at NYC

reviews.text: Except of rob. Hwo is avery good guy and was was very helpfull, the others were crep... horrible... antipathies bahhh
reviews.title: Bad very very bad

reviews.text: Weve changed room 3 times...
reviews.title: Great price but......

reviews.text: The 1th was small. Noisey. Bathrooms to midgets(no offence to midgets)
reviews.title: Budget Hotel, Amazing Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 2nd was bigger but still very noisey....
reviews.title: So close to everything

reviews.text: Arrived very late after a delayed Amtrax train. Booking in was quick & easy. We were on floor 3 so no troubles with the water a some reviewers experienced. Rooms are tiny as are the bathrooms & look pretty tatty. Air con did work but very noisy, view was a brick wall of another building.
reviews.title: Better hotels, maybe more honest employees

reviews.text: The hotel is walking distance to a lot I'd sites but to be honest, I think most hotels are and there are way better hotels out there. Breakfast was a nice touch, very nice muffins.
reviews.title: WoW

reviews.text: My main issue is after we arrived home I realised to my horror that I had left a bag at the hotel which contain all my souveniors & gifts. I was most upset about this & called thd hotel as soon as I could. Apparently however, I never stayed at their hotel, they could find no record of my name or booking despite me knowing my room number. We even called our agents to get the references & everything and called the hotel 3 times, at which point the person on the phone started to get very rude.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So on the Monday after I emailed them with my booking confirmation copy and voucher, to which I had no reply, I followed up on Friday, still nothing.
reviews.title: Great budget accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To which I have to say the customer service at this hotel is appalling, not even a reply to say sorry they could not find my bag. Staff are obviously dishonest so someone at the Walcott struck lucky with 100 dollars worth of stuff. There are better hotels out there & I would not recommend at all.
reviews.title: Basic but good service and perfect location

reviews.text: After a long research to choose the hotel for my first visit to New York City, the Wolcott Hotel seemed to be a good choice, mainly for its location and indeed it was a good selection. The hotel is conviniently located just a few steps from the 5th Av and 3 blocks from the Empire state building. There is a Walgreens store where you can find bottled water as well as a lot of snacks and if you need something more specific, there is a Duane Read store also very near, both of them on the 5th Av.
reviews.title: Great hotel for first time visitors!

reviews.text: The hotel Staff is really helpful and polite, they helped me with my delayed luggage and also with the booking process (on line).
reviews.title: Just decent

reviews.text: The rooms are nice, in my opinion, there is enough space for two - three people in a twin room and the best thing is taht you have a bathroom onside your room, so no need of sharing!
reviews.title: Excellent Price, Excellent Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another really good thing is the the Wolcott hotel offers complimentary coffee, tea and delicious muffins (cranberry and blueberry are a must!) every day, so it's a great way to start your day exploring the city.
reviews.title: Decent

reviews.text: Also, the hotel is near NYC Penn Station, so if you arrive at Newark, the hotel is just a couple of blocks walk.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in mid-August 2010 and we were very happy with our stay.
reviews.title: Big rooms (for NYC), would stay here again!

reviews.text: Prior our trip we had ordered some things online and had contacted the hotel to ask if they would store the things for us, as it was more then 2 weeks until our arrival. There was absolutely no problem with this and they reminded us of the packages when we checked-in and told us that they would be ready to be collected when it best suited us. The room was big with a big closet - perfect to store our shopping bags ;) The shower was somewhat weird, changing from boiling hot to freezing cold.. The bathroom was quite small, but sufficient. The muffins were tasty and the staff was friendly, plus the location was excellent. We would definately stay here again!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading some awful reviews about the state of the rooms and the service, I must say that I was a bit apprehensive about booking the hotel. But being on a budget, we could not pass on the special price of $115 for a junior suite (1 queen and 1 sofa-bed) in such a great location.
reviews.title: wouldn't recommend

reviews.text: The 3 of us arrived at the hotel at 7:00 a.m after a long bus ride from Toronto. We thought we could just leave our luggage somewhere in the hotel and then come back to check in later in the afternoon. To our surprise, the extremely helpful front desk person (thank you, Kabine) let us check in. He even invited us to have some breakfast in the lobby.
reviews.title: Great location, although our room was...

reviews.text: The suite was small but clean as was the bathroom. We did not expect anything fancy and therefore were not disappointed with it. We did not spend any time in the room except to take a shower and sleep anyway. The suite had a t.v in each room but I have no idea whether they worked because we never switched them on. It also had a rollaway bed under the sofa-bed (no mention of it in the room description). We did not find out until just before we left when we were checking under the beds to make sure we did not leave anything behind.
reviews.title: Not too bad for a short stay in NY

reviews.text: Amazing hotel - very good location, nice and not too small room. Clean, friendly and helpful services! I would give 5, but the only thing I didn't like, it was noisy at night, in december 2010 it was much more quiet over there! The muffins for breakfast were very good and tasty!.
reviews.title: Very good location and nice clean room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing hotel - very good location, very nice old decoration inside main hall - like old rococo.. Clean, friendly and helpful services! I would give 5 but only thing was a bit noisy nights, but it could be in any other hotel aswell! One more - amazing muffins for the morning breakfast! =)
reviews.title: Best value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a junior suite at the Wolcott -- sitting room with separate bedroom. Room had been refurbished so it was pleasant and clean. Bathroom with tub was modern with black and white tile. And the room was very quiet. The location was excellent -- we walked to the hotel from Penn Station -- and explored Koreatown restaurants a block away.
reviews.title: Good location, interesting neighborhood

reviews.text: Location was excellent. Staff and facilities very good. Everyone was very helpful especially the young maid who cleaned and tidied our room EVERY day. The early morning breakfast was very welcoming and enabled everyone to mix with other guests. My family and I went to Washington for a few days and the Hotel very kindly kept our luggage for 2 nights. I would stay at this Hotel again and would recommend it to anyone going to New York.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: My four sisters and I, accompanied by another lady, spent five days at the Wolcott during April 2012.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here in a triple room on the 12th floor with our teenage daughter for 4 nights in Nov. We took a taxi from JFK, it's a flat rate from the airport costing $45 plus the toll fee so comes to about $55. Well worth it or you'll be traipsing abou with your cases for hours! Check in was uneventful apart from the most miserable face EVER behind the front desk. I perservered with my charm and eventuallyher face cracked out the slightest of Mona Lisa smiles.....
reviews.title: Fine for a short break but......

reviews.text: The lobby is quite ornate but it stops there. Th room was very basic but clean. The bed linen was crisp & clean & the mattress looked new. (I checked on my paranoid quest to check for bed bugs! I didn't find any bugs either...)
reviews.title: Good value ,great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower was almost impossible to get to the right temperature and occasionally the water stopped flowing altogether for several seconds at a time which was distressing with a head full of shampoo. Our toilet blocked and overflowed but this was dealt with swiftly.
reviews.title: Wonderful location - good value

reviews.text: The heating throughout the hotel is ridiculously hot, we had to put the aircon on in November! There are clanking, hissing & gurgling sounds intermittently throughout the night, I presume from the aged central heating system.
reviews.title: Big room for 3,great location and clean

reviews.text: In the morning they serve tea, coffee & various muffins for breakfast which were tasty. Went down a treat with the teen.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: The location is ok. It is literally a five minute walk from the Empire State Building and that is the only perk. Good luck getting a cab, because they are on a side street and not very many cabs come down the road. They say they have a gift shop for snacks, but we never found it. The concierge didn't seem too interested in helping us that is when she was actually at the desk. The rooms are EXTREMLY dated and very very small. It may be cheap for NYC, but not worth it. We won't stay here again.
reviews.title: Not so great.

reviews.text: We spent a week at the Wolcott and found it a great base for exploring Manhattan. The rooms were comfortable and quiet with aircon, safe, iron, iPod dock, clock radio and so on. Room cleaning etc was good. The hotel is a couple of blocks away from subway stations at 28th and 34th streets, one block from the Empire State building and about ten metres from Fifth Avenue. They do coffee and muffins in the lobby, a wonderful rococo lounge.
reviews.title: Comfortable and centrally-placed Manhattan hotel

reviews.text: As three friends we stayed in a triple room at the beginning of June 2012; this was great as it meant we didn't have to pay a supplement or pay for another room. When booking I found this was one of the only hotels in NY that offered a triple room at a reasonable price!
reviews.title: Good comfortable hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was big enough for the 3 of us...two single beds in one room and another single in a little annex. The beds were very comfortable...we all managed to get a good nights sleep after busy days in New York.
reviews.title: Good location, good price

reviews.text: The bathroom was small...the wash basin was stupidly small...but the shower was nice an powerful. It was more than adequate for the 5 days we stayed. I'm not convinced the cleaners cleaned the bathroom properly during our stay; but at least it was clean when we arrived and our bedding was clean.
reviews.title: Affordable and great location

description: The Hotel Wolcott is located in the center of tourist New York. Near the Empire State building, UN, Macys, Circle Line, theater district, SOHO, the High Line and all public transportation. The Hotel offers clean comfortable, modern accommodations in an old-world atmosphere at reasonable prices year round. We have been written about in many domestic and international guides.
